x.definition: the 24th letter of the Roman alphabet

xanthate.definition: a salt or ester of xanthic acid

xanthelasma.definition: xanthoma of the eyelids; occurs chiefly in the elderly

xanthine.definition: crystalline oxidation product of the metabolism of nucleoproteins; precursor of uric acid; found in many organs and in urine

xanthium.definition: coarse herbs having small heads of greenish flowers followed by burrs with hooked bristles

xanthoma.definition: a skin problem marked by the development (on the eyelids and neck and back) of irregular yellow nodules; sometimes attributable to disturbances of cholesterol metabolism

xanthomatosis.definition: widespread xanthomas (especially on elbows and knees); often associated with a disorder of lipid metabolism

xanthomonas.definition: a genus of bacteria similar to Pseudomonas but producing a yellow pigment that is not soluble in water

xanthophyll.definition: yellow carotenoid pigments in plants and animal fats and egg yolks

xanthopsia.definition: visual defect in which objects appear to have a yellowish hue; sometimes occurs in cases of jaundice

xanthosis.definition: an abnormal yellow discoloration of the skin

xavier.definition: Spanish missionary and Jesuit who establish missionaries in Japan and Ceylon and the East Indies (1506-1552)

x-axis.definition: the horizontal axis in a plane coordinate system

xenicidae.definition: alternative names for the family comprising the New Zealand wrens

xenogeneic.definition: denoting or relating to cells or tissues from individuals belonging to different species

xenolith.definition: (geology) a piece of rock of different origin from the igneous rock in which it is embedded

xenon.definition: a colorless odorless inert gaseous element occurring in the earth's atmosphere in trace amounts

xenophobia.definition: a fear of foreigners or strangers

xenophobic.definition: suffering from xenophobia; having abnormal fear or hatred of the strange or foreign

xenophon.definition: Greek general and historian; student of Socrates (430-355 BC)

xenopodidae.definition: in some classifications the family of the genus Xenopus which is otherwise included in the family Pipidae

xenopus.definition: an African clawed frog; in some classifications made the type genus of a separate family Xenopodidae

xenosaurus.definition: type and sole genus of Xenosauridae: slender-bodied Mexican lizards having the upper surface covered with tiny granules and tubercles

xenotime.definition: a brown-to-yellow mineral that is a phosphate of yttrium in crystalline form

xeranthemum.definition: any plant of the genus Xeranthemum native to southern Europe having chaffy or silvery flower heads with purplish tubular flowers

xeroderma.definition: a mild form of ichthyosis characterized by abnormal dryness and roughness of the skin

xerography.definition: forming an image by the action of light on a specially coated charged plate; the latent image is developed with powders that adhere only to electrically charged areas

examples.en: edge enhancement is intrinsic in xerography

xerophyllum.definition: small genus of North American herbs having grasslike basal leaves: squaw grass; sometimes placed in family Melanthiaceae

xerophytic.definition: adapted to a xeric (or dry) environment

xerophthalmia.definition: abnormal dryness of the conjunctiva and cornea of the eyes; may be due to a systemic deficiency of vitamin A

xerostomia.definition: abnormal dryness of the mouth resulting from decreased secretion of saliva

xerox.definition:
1) a copy made by a xerographic printer
2) a duplicator (trade mark Xerox) that copies graphic matter by the action of light on an electrically charged photoconductive insulating surface in which the latent image is developed with a resinous powder

xhosa.definition:
1) a member of the Negroid people of southern South Africa
2) a community of Negroid people in southern South Africa
3) a Bantu language closely related to Zulu

xi.definition: the 14th letter of the Greek alphabet

xian.definition: a city of central China; capital of ancient Chinese empire 221-206 BC

xylaria.definition: type genus of Xylariaceae; fungi with perithecia in the upper part of erect black woody stromata

xylariaceae.definition: family of fungi characterized by dark brown to black spores

xylem.definition: the woody part of plants: the supporting and water-conducting tissue, consisting primarily of tracheids and vessels

xylene.definition: a colorless flammable volatile liquid hydrocarbon used as a solvent

xylopia.definition: tropical evergreen trees or shrubs; chiefly African

xylosma.definition: shrub or small tree grown as an ornamental in mild climates for its neat evergreen foliage and fragrant late flowers; native of China

xyridaceae.definition: plants of tropical to temperate regions; usually in wet places

xyris.definition: chiefly American marsh plants, having usually yellow flowers

x-ray.definition:
1) examine by taking x-rays
2) take an x-ray of something or somebody

xx.definition: (genetics) normal complement of sex chromosomes in a female

xxx.definition: (genetics) abnormal complement of three X chromosomes in a female
